texts.ru: Бахрому 20 лет. Его родители живут на Севере Таджикистана, а он сам переехал на столицу, чтобы поступить в университет. Он студент 3 курса Аграрного Университета Таджикистана. Он является одним из успешных студентов и активно участвует в жизни университета. Бахром должен оплатить за учебный договор, но доход его родителей не хватает для этого. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе ему поможем окончить университет.
texts.en:
Bahrom is 20 years old. His parents live in the north of Tajikistan, but he lives on his own in the capital to go to university. He is a third-year student at the Agrarian University of Tajikistan. He is one of the successful students and is actively involved in university life. Bahrom must pay for his school contract, but his parents' income is not enough for this. 

He is requesting a loan to pay for the school contract. He is awaiting your kindness. Let's help him together to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Víveres, renchos y bebidas, fue lo que compró Daniela con su anterior credikiva, con el que aumentó su inventario y así mismo las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando  a un nuevo credito, con el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, bebida; su inversión tendrá éxito porque está localizada en un punto muy concurrido, donde lleva mucho tiempo de permanencia y es muy reconocida por su vecindad. Su mensaje a los finaciadoresde Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias por apoyarme en crecer. "
texts.en: Daniela used her previous Kiva loan to buy food items, snacks and beverages she used to increase her inventory and as a result, her sales.  She’s currently applying for a new loan to buy food items, snacks and beverages.  The investment will be successful because she’s located in a very busy spot and has been there for a long time so she’s well-known in her neighborhood.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks for helping me grow.”

loans.use: to buy food items, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en: Faipaipai is 21 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for two years. Fiapaipai has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, box of chicken leg quarters, and other necessary ingredients. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapaipai will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, boxes of chicken, sausages, sauce,  and oil..

loans.name: Uaine

texts.en: Uaine is 29 years old and married with one child. She makes and sells printed clothes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Uaine has requested a loan to buy materials, paints, brushes, and elei wood. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Uaine joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, brushes, and elei wood.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a married woman and a mother of three young children, from Talibon, Bohol. She has run a water refilling business for almost three years. This is the source of her income.

Dulce works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of their children. Dulce is asking for a loan to buy more containers for her water refilling business. With this, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy more containers for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, Administra una tienda de venta de granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad, él vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, todos dependen económicamente de él, Este negocio está instalado en la vivienda de un familiar, donde lo atienden todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa, ya que es una fuente mayor de ingresos para el hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar entre otros productos que son necesarios para el negocio, este crédito le ayudara a que su negocio tenga los productos deseados, para atender a los clientes para que se mantengan comprando.
Su aspiración es tener mayores ingresos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tambien esto le servirá para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos manages a store selling basic grains and basic staples.  He lives with his family consisting of his wife and two children who are 12 and 7 years of age; all depend on him economically.  The business is located at home and he and his wife tend to it daily since it’s the family’s main source of income.

He’s requesting a loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans and sugar among other products needed for the business.  This loan will help his store have the desired products to tend to customers so that they will continue buying.  His hope is to earn higher income so his children can stay in school and also so that he can help his parents.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Izzatullo

texts.ru: Иззатулло проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Жена Иззатулло домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Иззатулло разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Иззатулло берет кредит для закупа бычков и коров, чтобы продолжить свое дело.
texts.en:
Izzatullo lives in the Bohtar region. He is 38 years old, married and has five children. Izzatullo's wife is a homemaker. On his own, he engages in raising livestock. Izzatullo breeds cattle for sale in the future. He has been engaged in this type of activity for 15 years. 

Izzatullo is taking a loan to buy bulls and cows, in order to continue his activities.

loans.use: to buy bulls and cows

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор второй раз кредитуется в нашей организации. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность. Гулбахор разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она берет кредит для закупа бычков и быка.
texts.en: Gulbahor is taking a loan from our organization for the second time. She wants to expand her activities. Gulbahor breeds cattle near her home. She is taking a loan to buy bulls and an ox.

loans.use: to buy bulls and an ox

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and shrimp

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Нуриддин проживает в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Нуриддин зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области ему помогает его жена. Нуриддин разводит скот у себя дома. У него дома имеются необходимые условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Скотоводством он занимается десять лет. 
Нуриддин берет кредит для закупа телят и бычков.
texts.en:
Nuriddin lives in the Zafarobod district of the city of Istaravshan. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Nuriddin makes his living by breeding cattle. His wife helps him with this work. Nuriddin breeds livestock near his home. His house has the necessary conditions for raising cattle. He has been doing this work for ten years. 

Nuriddin is taking a loan to buy calves and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase calves and bulls

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 55 años, vive con su pareja, ya que sus hijos ya dejaron el hogar. Su vivienda es propia y se ubica en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 35 años atrás, cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños. De esa manera logró educarlos y criarlos. Ahora ella y su esposo se encargan de limpiar y cultivar sus productos. “En mis 4 parcelas de terrenos tenemos cultivados café, kión, yuca, paltas y frutos cítricos; así no nos falta dinero para todo el año”, menciona.
Hermelinda es muy inteligente, sabe como negociar sus productos, por eso los lleva a los mercados en fechas determinadas, cuando los precios son más beneficiosos.
Estos días se dirigirá a los montes (donde están sus parcelas), para dedicarse a las limpiezas y mantenimiento de sus cultivos, para ello requiere bolsas de abono orgánico, son sus planes más cercanos. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP. Anteriormente mostró puntualidad en los pagos, y no duda en hacerlo esta vez. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, y le agrada el trabajo que se realiza.
Con el dinero podrá comprar las bolsas de abono orgánico necesarias para sus cultivos de café, kión y paltas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 55, lives with her spouse since her children have already left home.  Her house is hers and is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  She’s been working in agriculture for 35 years since when her children were little.  She managed to raise them and school them this way.  Now, she and her husband are in charge of weeding and growing their products.  “On my four parcels of land, we grow coffee, ginger, manioc, avocadoes and citrus fruit; this way we earn money year-round,” she mentions.  Hermelinda is very intelligent; she knows how to negotiate her products which is why she takes them to market on determined days which is when prices are most beneficial.

In these days she heads up into the mountains (where here parcels are located) to do the weeding and crop maintenance.  To do so, she needs sacks of organic manure; this is her most immediate plan.  This will be MFP loan #5.  She was punctual with her previous payments and has no doubt she’ll be so again now.  She’s a member of the “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” (Shankivironi Little Carnations) and she likes the work it does.  She will be able buy sacks of organic manure needed for the coffee, ginger and avocado crops with the money.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Argentina is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope) 4. This group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural town where the economy is based around agriculture. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She is a divorced woman.

Argentina sells miscellaneous products from her home--products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and others. She started her business with some savings and by taking credits from different suppliers. This is how she financed her business until she was invited to a meeting where her neighbors explained about Esperanza International and this program. She was very excited and took her first loan to invest in her business. That was four years ago. Now, she is taking her eighth loan with Esperanza International.  

Argentina is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She is planning to use it to increase her inventory. She will reinvest her profits in her desire to expand her business into a Fantasia (a small miscellaneous product store). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, age 50, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Together with her children she manages their household, while operating her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells RTW (ready-to-wear clothing), for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her prepared food business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for meals, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes hopes to grow her business and dreams that her children will have a good future, by the grace of God. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients for the meals she prepares and sells, including meats, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Liutasi

texts.en: Liutasi is 51 years old, married, and has nine children. She would like to start a sewing business. In order to do so, Liutasi is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine, materials, needles, and scissors. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and provide a better future for her children. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, materials, needles, and scissors.

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en: Isapela is a 34-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing a vegetable garden to earn a living. Isapela has requested a loan to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, chemicals, a water hose, and seeds. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Isapela will spend her profits to extend and improve her business and for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, a water hose, and gloves.

loans.name: Salu Akenese

texts.en: Salu Akenese is 52 years old and married with 12 children. She would like to start a small sewing business. In order to do this, Salu Akenese needs a loan to buy a new sewing machine, more materials, and other supplies. She hopes to use her profits to improve and maintain her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, materials, and fabric.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 39 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  16 y 18 años que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica a la fabricación de muñecas artesanales, ella tiene un puesto fijo donde los vende y los distribuye cuando tiene pedidos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria utilizara el préstamo para compra de material como ( tela, lana, hilos, silicona) para la fabricación de sus muñecas ya que esta época de fin de año tiene mucha mas demanda con algunas instituciones que le realizan pedidos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es un incremento en los pedidos de sus clientes y la falta de capital para la compra de material por mayor, Maria va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de material para incrementar la producción de muñecas y por ende  su capital su deseo es contar con una microempresa y poder contratar nano de obra.
texts.en: María, 39, is single with two children who are 16 and 18 years of age and attending school.  She works making artisanal dolls and has a fixed stand where she sells them; she also distributes them based on prior orders.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and María will use the loan to buy supplies like fabric, yarn, thread and silicone to make dolls because demand at the end of the year is much higher from institutions that place orders with her.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the increase in customer orders and lack of capital to buy supplies at wholesale.  María will use profits to buy supplies to increase doll production and thus her capital.  Her wish is to have a micro business and hire staff.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make dolls.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and seven children, for whom she and her husband work very hard to provide everything they need. Julia works selling makuti (palm fronds used for thatching) from her home. It is a very stable business and during peak seasons, especially the rainy seasons, it provides very good profits.

Julia is requesting a loan from Yehu with which she will have enough money to buy makuti for resale. She says that she currently has many orders, which she intends to fulfill before the heavy rains start.

loans.use: to buy makuti (palm fronds used for thatching) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru: Саиднисо   работает в типографии переплетчицей уже много лет.  У неё двое взрослых детей, которые имеют свои семьи.  Сын Саиднисо живет с матерью в одном доме и помогает ей в хозяйстве. Она постоянно работала в бюджетной организации и зарабатывала на жизнь, вырастила и выдала дочь из своей зарплаты со своим мужем.  Супруги частично распределяли свою получку на свои расходы и  не могли откладывать.  Саиднисо  получив кредит, намного улучшила свои бытовые условия и провела несколько мероприятий и частично оплачивала. Ей понравилось и теперь не переставая получает наши кредиты,потому что, не может накопить большие суммы. На полученный кредит хочет купить мягкую мебель о котором так  долго мечтала.  Она благодарит нас за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Saidniso has been working in printing for many years. She has two grown children who are married. Saidniso's son lives with his mother in one house and helps with the household. She always worked in the public organization to make a living, raise and married off her daughter out of her salary with her husband. The spouses partially distribute their pay to cover their expenses and they couldn't be postponed.  

Saidniso got a loan, much improved her living conditions, held several events and partially repaid. She liked it and now continually receives our loans, because she cannot accumulate large amounts. She wants to use the loan to buy furniture for which she has long dreamed. She thanks us for the financial support. 

She always worked in the public organization and make a living, grow and give her daughter out of her salary to her husband. Spouses partially distribute their pay at their costs and could not be postponed.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa Librada”  están  en el Tercer Ciclo   con 19  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables,  ellas tienen actividades diferentes, pero también trabajan juntas y así están pasando sin problemas los ciclos.
Lucia, una de las miembros, cuenta que ella vende comestibles de todo tipo, y que le va muy bien, ya que siempre tuvo muy buena habilidad para la cocina y que ahora eso la ayuda a salir adelante. Su meta es poder tener un gran comedor y así trabajar.
Pide esta ayuda para la compra de condimentos, carnes, aderezos y demás, para seguir haciendo los alimentos que siempre hace.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Santa Librada" is in its third loan cycle with 19 members.  This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood by being very united, supportive, and responsible.  They have different businesses, but they also work together and they are completing the loan cycles without problems. 

Lucia, one of the members, says that she sells foods of all types and that she is doing well.  She was always skilled in the kitchen and now that helps her to move forward.  Her goal is to have a big restaurant and work that way.

She is asking for help to buy condiments, meats, seasoning, and the like in order to continue making the foods that she always makes.

loans.use: to buy condiments, meats, seasoning, etc

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is a 44-year-old woman and the head of a household that includes her mother and her five children. They live in a Ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Bayarjargal, is 23 and works at a private mining company. Her second son, Bayarbayasgalan, is 20 and disabled and stays at home. Her younger three children, Buyanhishig, Sukhbat and Bazarsad, are secondary school students. 

Tuya has been running a grocery store business at a rental counter in the local market for years. Unfortunately, business has been temporarily stopped for months because of a lack of working capital. She is now requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase various types of goods for her grocery store. She is a hardworking, brave, and responsible woman.

loans.use: To purchase various types of goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children. She is from Talibon, Bohol. Gregoria has run a sari-sari, or convenience, store business for several years now. This is the source of her income. 

Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as soda, canned goods, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to sell more goods to the people in her location. In the future, Gregoria dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soda, canned goods, and toiletries.

loans.name: Omar Isidro

texts.es: Omar Isidro de 39 anos de edad, casado con dos hijos de 16,9 anos de edad, de la localidad de León, lugar que esta ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. Él tiene por actividad económica el servicio de pintura  contratado  por las distintas empresas de la localidad .Tiene 15 anos de desempeñarse en el negocio. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener  un medio de trabajo para brindarles estabilidad económica a sus hijos. Omar Isidro ha demostrado su responsabilidad en los créditos anteriores los cuales han sido de mucha ayuda para seguir en el negocio y mantener su fuente de trabajo. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar materiales como: pintura de aceite, rodos, escaleras, brochas, plástico negro, ciner. Omar Isidro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Omar Isidro is 39 years old, married, and has two children (ages 16 and 9). He is from the town of León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. Omar provides painting services as a contractor to different businesses in his town. He has 15 years of experience in this line of work.

Omar’s business was started out of necessity because he needed work so that he could provide financial stability for his children. He has demonstrated responsibility with his previous loans, since they have been very helpful in continuing his business and maintaining a source of income.

This needed loan will be invested as operating capital for purchasing materials such as oil-based paints, rollers, brushes, ladders, black plastic, and paint thinner. Omar Isidro is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy oil-based paints, rollers, brushes, ladders, black plastic, and paint thinner.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo de 53 años, convive con Teodosia. Ellos viven con un hijo en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Pablo es un hombre responsable y carismático. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. En los 6 terrenos que su comunidad le otorgó cultiva café y un poco de plátano. “Me dedico a producir más café porque es más rentable y porque ya tengo clientes fijos en cada cosecha”, menciona.
Pero para obtener buenas cosechas también tiene que esmerarse en los cuidados y en la fertilización. 
Cada 6 meses realiza el mantenimiento de estos cultivos, para ello adquiere bolsas de abono orgánico. A veces tiene que contratar personal para culminar a tiempo con esta actividad, pero como Pablo dispone el tiempo con inteligencia no tiene problemas en ello. Esta vez realizará el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Requiere de su apoyo. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Acaba de formar parte del banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, y muestra predisposición para las actividades a realizarse. Con los 500 soles comprará 10 bolsas de abono orgánico, como el guano de ave de granja, para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Pablo, 53, lives with Teodosia.  They live with one child in their own home, located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Pablo is a responsible and charismatic person.  His main activity is farming.  He cultivates coffee and a small amount of bananas on 6 parcels of land that he was granted by his community.  "I'm engaged in producing more coffee because it is very profitable, and because I already have regular customers for each harvest," he says.

However, to get good harvests he also has to take pains to care for the crops and fertilize them.  He does this crop maintenance every 6 months, and this requires him to get sacks of organic fertilizer.  At times he has to hire people to finish this activity on time, but as Pablo arranges his time intelligently, this creates no problems for him.   This time, he will carry out the maintenance work on his crops, and he needs your support.  This is Pablo's first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments on time.  

Pablo is a member of the communal bank “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi," and he shows a willingness to participate in its activities.  With the 500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer, such as poultry guano, for his coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de ropa y a realizar la sastrería, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y nietos, ella y su esposo son los que trabajan por el hogar, su negocio lo constituye mediante la confección de ropa la cual vende, como calzonetas, vestidos de niñas, trabaja casi todos los días desde hace 10 años.
Solicita un préstamo para comprase por mayoreo la tela que es utilizada para confeccionar las prendas de vestir con las que comercializa, tambien materiales como ciper, botones, hilo, que le ayudaran a mantener  lo necesario para trabajar, se acercan la época de graduaciones para la cual tiene más demanda, la inversión le permitirá estar capacitada.
Los sueños de María son tener un ingreso mayor del negocio, en las fiestas de fin de año tener más comodidad.
texts.en:
María works selling clothes and doing tailoring.  She lives with her husband, children and grandchildren.  She and her husband are the ones that work for the home.  The business consists in selling clothes like shorts and girls’ dresses she makes.  She works almost every day and has been doing so for ten years.

She requests a loan to buy the fabric she uses at wholesale to make the clothes she sells.  She will also buy supplies like zippers, buttons and thread that will help her have what she needs to work.  Graduation season is approaching and demand rises so the investment will allow her to take advantage of it.  María’s dream is to earn higher income from the business during the end-of-year festivities and to have more comfort.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread.

loans.name: Abelizario

texts.es:
Abelizario, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos dependen de él, su esposa le ayuda con la venta de tortillas ha obtener ingresos para el hogar. Abelizario se dedica a la sastrería, atiende un molino y en la venta de gallinas, lo realiza todos los días desde hace 15 años.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas para confeccionar las prendas, tambien le dará mantenimiento al molino y comprara concentrado para las gallinas, esto le ayudara a que su negocio tenga estabilidad, invirtiendo en sus tres ocupaciones.
El quiere con el préstamo tener la facilidad de mejorar sus condiciones actúales.
texts.en:
Abelizario lives with his wife and children; all  are dependent ton him.  His wife helps him by selling tortillas to earn household income.  Abelizario works as a tailor, runs a mill and sells chickens.  He’s done this every day for the last 15 years.

He’s requesting a loan to buy fabric to make clothing and also to repair the mill and to buy chicken feed.  This will help his business attain stability by investing in all three occupations.  He hopes the loan will help him improve his current conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, repair the corn mill and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María, vive con sus tres hijos, está soltera, tiene el apoyo de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y tambien a las labores agrícolas, estas actividades las aprendió con sus padres, tiene aproximadamente 15 años cultivando maíz.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, para realizar la siembra de temporada, además tambien comprar cerdos para el destazo; este crédito le ayudara para suministrar los insumos para la cosecha de maíz.
El objetivo de Maria es mejorar la producción y la venta de carne, tener una mejor situación económica para ayudar a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is single and lives with her three children and has a family that supports her. She works selling meat and doing farm work. She learned these trades from her parents and she has been growing corn for around 15 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy the compost and weedkiller she needs for the sewing season, and also to buy pigs to slaughter. This loan will help her to buy the necessary supplies for corn harvesting. 

Maria's aim is to increase her production and sales of meat, and to improve her economic situation so that she can support her three children.

loans.use: to buy compost, weedkiller, and pigs.

loans.name: Edy Marleny

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza y tambien se sigue dedicando a la elaboracion de panes,la socia vende panes en la plaza desde las 8:00 a.m hsta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar harina,azucar,leche y huevos para preparar panes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues selling beer and also baking bread.  She sells bread in the square from 8am until 5pm.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the bread.  She requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, milk and eggs to make bread.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and beads.

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: Alba Lorena de 42 anos de edad, del municipio del Sauce, casado con dos hijos de 19, 9 anos de edad los dos está estudiando. Alba tiene por actividad  económica la venta de ganado y leche, negocio que lo  tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace  22 anos que se desempeña en dicha actividad. El negocio lo aprendió de su papa, y con ayuda del esposo es que pudo salir adelante, para tener un medio de vida digno para sacar adelante a sus hijos. La rutina de Alba Lorena es salir 3 tres veces por semana a las comunidades aledañas a buscar ganado en pie para la compra y venta del mismo.  Y también vender leche en su casa de habitación en horas temprana de la mañana. El los créditos anteriores ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un  ganado que se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio. Alba Lorena agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a pequeños comerciantes de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Alba Lorena is 42 years old and from the town of El Sauce. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 9, who are studying. Alba sells cattle and milk. Her business is located at her home where she has been in operation for the past 22 years. She learned this trade from her father and now her husband helps with moving the business forward so that they can live a decent life and help their children get ahead.

Alba Lorena’s routine consists of traveling to the surrounding communities three times a week to buy live cattle and to also make sales. She also sells milk from her home during the early morning hours. With her previous loans, Alba demonstrated responsibility by paying on time and according to the terms.

The loan she is requesting will be invested as operating capital so that she can buy cattle being offered at a good price. Alba Lorena is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to small businesspeople from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia de 35 años de edad, vive en un tradicional barrio de la ciudad, allí tiene su estudio de grabación, actividad a la que se dedicó, porque aunque es profesional de la enfermería, su inclinación por el emprendimiento es muy grande y por eso se asoció con su primo que es ingeniero de sonido y organizaron su propio estudio de grabación. Ellos  cuentan con todos los equipos técnicos para ofrecer el servicio de grabar cuñas radiales, voces de cortometrajes y también aprovechando que su primo es músico preparan y ensayan a jóvenes dedicados a este oficio, producen música de fondo  para documentales de películas y de eventos culturales. Patricia es beneficiaria del macroproyecto de vivienda sostenible  villas de San Pablo y ha pagado muy bien sus cuotas por las cuales se esmera, pues su propósito es tener una reputación financiera extraordinaria para crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual hará remodelaciones a su estudio para lograr un total aislamiento acústico. Su credikiva es el quinto financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y su sueño es continuar ampliando su negocio, para lograr obtener un reconocimiento local y regional en el país.
texts.en:
Patricia, 35, lives in one of the city’s traditional neighborhoods.  She has a recording studio there.  She went into this business because even though she’s a nurse, her inclination towards entrepreneurship is very strong so she partnered with her sound engineer cousin to set up their own recording studio.  They have all the technical equipment to provide recording services of radio jingles, voice-overs for short films, etc. and taking advantage of the fact that her cousin is a musician too they prepare and rehearse young people who are in this line of work and produce background music for documentary films and cultural events.

Patricia is also a beneficiary of the San Pablo sustainable housing macro project and has made her payments punctually and she strives to earn an extraordinary financial reputation in order to grow. She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan to remodel her studio in order to make it completely soundproof.  Her Kiva loan will be the fifth loan she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her dream is to continue expanding her business to become known in the counrty both locally and regionally.

loans.use: to completely soundproof her studio.

loans.name: Elyor

texts.ru: Элёр трудолюбивый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Дети еще маленькие. Условия жизни у них  очень тяжелые. С ранних лет он работал на поле, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Семье принадлежит участок земли площадью 5 га. Эльёр вместе с женой и родителями занимается выращиванием зерновых.  Уже более 10 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Его заботливая жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай он  продает местным жителям по более низкой цене, чем на базаре, с первых рук. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования. Элёр планирует купить скота для расширения бизнеса и таким образом получить больше дохода. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Элёр ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Elyor is a hardworking man, he is married and is raising three children.  The children are still young.  Their living conditions are very difficult.  He has worked in the fields from an early age in order to earn money to support his family.  The family owns a 5 acre plot of land.  Together with his wife and parents Elyor grows grain crops.  He has been in this business for more then 10 years.  His caring wife helps him to run the business.  He sells the harvest directly to local residents for a lower price than at the market.  A large part of the population in this area purchases wheat, then grinds flour at the mill and bakes bread for personal use.  Elyor plans to buy livestock in order to grow his business and thereby increase his income.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni for the purchase of livestock.  Elyor is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,la socia cria vhanchos y gallinas,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender lso animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chanchos y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Eliana continues working in the animal-raising business. She raises pigs and hens which she fattens and then sells in various markets. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and has been working in this trade for 6 years. Her dream is to have her own premises and sell her animals from there. Eliana is requesting a loan to buy pigs, hens, and animal feed. She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs, hens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Najma, 43 years old, is an active lady who lives with her husband, two sons and three daughters in the city of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver, while their elder son is an electrician. Her elder daughter is getting married soon and Najma is worried, as she has insufficient savings to meet her wedding expenses.

Because of her husband’s limited earning power, three years ago Najma began stitching at home for the people who live in her neighbourhood. She serves her community well and has become famous for providing good-quality service.

Her earnings, unfortunately, have been interrupted because her stitching machine is no longer functioning. As a member of a six-person lending group, Najma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new stitching machine for her tailoring business. This will help her to increase savings and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine for her small tailoring business.

loans.name: Mark John

texts.en:
Mark John is a 26-year-old man and a father of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. He has operated a motorcycle transport business for more than 2 years now. He transports passengers and small amounts of cargo from one place to another.

Mark John is asking for a loan to buy fuel for his motorcycle and pay for his children's school fees.

In the future, Mark John hopes to make his business a success. He also wants to explore other ventures to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle fuel and pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Teko Pora Group

texts.es:
Teko Pora tiene 15 miembros, donde todas se han unido con el objetivo de ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres muy laboriosas que siempre han trabajado y quieren seguir haciéndolo por sus hijos.
La Sra. Marcela, presidenta del grupo, tiene su despensa hace ya un buen tiempo. Tiene un negocio bien surtido y eso le ayuda a poder tener muy buena clientela siempre. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y trabajando y así ser una gran microempresaria.
Marcela solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, cárnicos, panificados, frutas y verduras, con los que va a tener mejor surtido su negocio y así seguir dando una buena variedad como siempre a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teko Pora has 15 members, who have come together with the aim of helping their families. They are very hard-working women who have always worked, and want to continue to work for their children. 

Señora Marcela, who is leader of the group, has owned her shop for a long time now. She has a well-stocked business and this always helps her to maintain a very good customer base. Her aim is to be able to continue growing and working, and in doing so become a great micro-entrepreneur. 

Marcela is requesting this loan in order to buy drinks, meat and dairy products, baked goods, fruits, and vegetables, so that her shop is better stocked and she can continue to offer as wide a variety as ever to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat and dairy products, baked goods, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es: El Sr. Basilio tiene 30 años casado con cinco hijos de las edades de 11, 9, 7, 4 y 2 años, el  se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz y maní en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de  Belén,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Basilio va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maní y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Basilio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Basilio, 30, is married and has five children who are 11, 9, 7, 4 and 2 years of age.  He works in agriculture growing a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, manioc, corn and peanuts.  His parcel is located in the community of Belén.  This loan is his fourth sequence in the institution and Basilio will use it to prepare the soil for his peanut crop.  The reason for requesting the loan is to have resources for planting and to be able to subsist.  The business challenge Basilio faces is weather extremes that sometimes ruin crops.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life because he’s responsible for all household expenses.  He’s a responsible, hardworking man who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 51, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She together, with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eden operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Eden hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a very dedicated woman who is always on the lookout for opportunities. She is happy to have achieved some of her goals. Amina has been farming for several years. Recently, she has had a retail shop which sells to the neighborhood. She rents her store, but she says that it is not spacious enough for expansion. She wants to rent a bigger store in which she will stock more merchandise to sell. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to enable her to rent a bigger store. She is sure to have more sales.

loans.use: to rent a bigger store.

loans.name: Teobaldo

texts.es:
Teobaldo de 46 años, convive con Vaceliza con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero vive con 4 de ellos. Ellos viven en una casa propia que Teobaldo construyó en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Teobaldo es un hombre de principios y valores. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 18 años. En todo este tiempo consolidó unos terrenos donde produce café, yucas, frutas cítricas. Pero menciona que el agrada producir más café, porque el precio de venta es mayor y la demanda también le favorece.
“Tengo como 4 hectáreas de terrenos que la comunidad me dio, por eso la mayor parte del día la paso en mis parcelas”, menciona.
El principal problema que tiene es la falta de capital para adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico, semillas y para el pago al personal que contrata para estas labores.
Anhela ser uno de los productores cuya cosecha sea negociada en otras ciudades, es decir un vendedor mayorista, por ello se esmera en aumentar su producción y terrenos. Éste es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Al igual que en los préstamos anteriores se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, donde es un socio activo y responsable.
Invertirá los 1000 soles en el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos, además comprará bolsas de abono orgánico como guano de ave de corral.
texts.en:
Teobaldo is 46 years old. He lives with the mother of his five children and four of those children. The family lives in its own house that Teobaldo build in his native community near the central jungle region. Teobaldo is a man of principles and values. For the 18 years, he has made a living in agriculture. He has consolidated various plots of land on which he produces coffee, yuca (a potato-like food), and citric fruits. He would like to grow more coffee because it has a high demand and market price. However, he is not yet able to expand his coffee crop, “I have about four hectares of land that the community gave me, so I spend most of the day on those plots,” says Teobaldo.

The main problem Teobaldo identifies is a lack of capital to buy bags of organic fertilizer, seeds, and to pay the wages of contracted laborers to help with the work. He would like to become a wholesaler whose products are bought in other cities, therefore Teobaldo strives to increase his land plots and production. 

This is Teobaldo's seventh loan with MFP. Just like with his previous loans, he pledges to make his monthly repayments on time. He is an active and responsible member of the communal bank "Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi." Teobaldo will invest the 1000 soles in the wages of contracted labor to help collect his crops, as well as to buy bags of organic fertilizer, such as guano (bird droppings).

loans.use: to hire day labor and to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en: Antonina is from Lusot, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Antonina is married and has four children. To make a living, Antonina cultivates bananas and coconuts to sell. Antonina has been in this business for 10 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. Antonina is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Antonina joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cherriemy

texts.en:
For over five years in Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Cherriemy, a 51-year-old married mother of 2 children, has made a with her general store , where she sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Recently, Cherriemy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been involved in selling shoes for four years, working seven days a week. She also gets additional income from agriculture and animal rearing.

She has requested a loan of USHS 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more shoes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her businesses. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charge on loans. She stays in her husband's house, which has access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni de 38 años, esta casada con Constantin de 49 años, producto de un calido hogar tienen dos hijos, Omar de 11 años y Karen de 20. Juntos habitan en una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Con el entusiasmo de trabajar y salir adelante inicio su propio negocio, que consiste en la venta de lubricantes y otros para vehículos de todas las marcas, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 8 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de combustible pero al notar que el consumo de gas natural vehicular inicio su expansión en nuestro país orientó su camino hacia este negocio generándole buenas ganancias. Desempeña su labor conjuntamente con su esposo Constantin quien ha sido desde siempre una gran ayuda y cuya presencia es permanente permitiéndole a ella desempeñar las gestiones correspondientes.
Como parte de la compra comercial al por mayor que realizan cada cierto periodo se presentó una oferta especial por parte de sus proveedores mayoristas consistente en la distribución de 100 cajas de aceite  lubricante a un precio módico, ocasión que como comerciante no puede desaprovechar ya que gracias a ello logrará mantener su negocio abastecido por un periodo prolongado.
Como parte del crecimiento desea a futuro aperturar otra tienda dedicada a la venta y distribución de llantas para todo tipo de vehículos, pues tiene la plena seguridad que con trabajo y esfuerzo será posible lograrlo. Tiene un limpio historial de crédito, siendo este su préstamo número 19. Es integrante de la junta directiva de su banco comunal  desempeñando su labor de manera firme ya que considera a su grupo muy unido y con amplia responsabilidad de pago.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado a la compra de una oferta consistente en 1000 cajas de aceite lubricante para vehículos diversos.
texts.en:
Marleni is 38 years old and married to Constantin, age 49. Their loving household also includes their two children, Omar (age 11) and Karen (age 20). They all live in a home that is made of solid materials. With the drive to work and move forward, Marleni started her own business. She sells lubricants and other auto supplies of all brands. Marleni has been in business for the past eight years. She previously sold fuel, but she states that the use of natural gas for vehicles was just starting to expand throughout the country. This opened the door for a business that could generate good earnings. She shares the duties with her husband Constantin, who has always been a great help and a permanent fixture in assisting her with making the necessary arrangements.

A commercial wholesaler is currently in the middle of a promotion that is being offered to its customers. Those who purchase 100 cases of motor oil will receive a reduced price. Marleni does not want to miss out on this opportunity since it will help to maintain her business and keep it stocked for a prolonged length of time.

As part of her future growth, Marleni wants to open another shop that is dedicated to selling and delivering tires for all types of vehicles. She is very confident that she can achieve this goal through hard work and effort. Marleni has a clean credit history and will be receiving her 19th loan. She is a member of the Board of Directors for her Communal Bank. Marleni and the other Board members work together as a close-knit group and have great responsibilities with handling the payments.

With this loan of 2,000 PEN, Marleni will be able to complement her existing capital so that she can buy 1,000 cases of lubricants for different types of vehicles.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 cases of vehicle lubricants.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is 45 years old, widowed, and lives with her five children. She has a store where she sells basic household necessities, such as beans, rice, bread, instant products, soap and other items.

She has several years with the business, and that has given her valuable experience in sales, which allows her to obtain better earnings. The business is located in her home and is very well known. She has a large clientele, as people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality and affordable. In addition to the unequaled service, she is always at the service of her customers.

Mwanamvua is an energetic, hard-working woman with many goals for the future. She is ready to do her very best, as she knows that only in this way will she be able to fulfill her dreams and achieve success.

As every good business person does, she wants to see her business grow and also wants to undertake new investments; however, she doesn't have sufficient working capital, and that is why she is applying to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, bread, candy, instant products, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du  groupe ADONAÏM 2.  Zenabo se porte très bien et a décidé de ceder sa place de représentante du groupe à Bintou.  Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a trois (03) personnes  en charge.

Mme vend des combustibles (bois de chauffe)  depuis 03ans. Elle se fait livrer à domicile. Ses clients sont les voisines.

Elle veut s’acheter un demi-camion de bois de chauffe.

Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne acheter une moto et aider son mari pour la scolarisation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. BINTOU is the official of the group ADONAÏM 2.  Zenabo is well and has decided to give up her spot as the group's representative to Bintou, who is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 4. Two are going to school. And she has three persons to support. 

Bintou has been selling fuel (firewood) for three years. Deliveries are made to her home. Her customers are her neighbors. 

She wants to purchase a half truckload of firewood.

She is saving her profits. Her ambition is to purchase a motorbike and to help out her husband in covering her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase a half truckload of firewood

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Soumaïla a 36 ans, marié et père de quatre enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou II Extension un des quartiers populaires de la ville  de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Soumaïla après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  il y a douze ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il vend ses articles : Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Après avoir correctement remboursé les 2 prêts précédents, il est à son troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 12 cartons du thé, 10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing-gum, 12 paquets d’allumettes et 8 cartons de savon. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt .
texts.en:
Soumaïla is 36 years of age, married, and a father to four children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou, an extension to one of the popular neighborhoods of the village of Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

After many unsuccessful businesses, 12 years ago Soumaïla started working selling miscellaneous articles, and has a store in front of his family home where he sells his items: cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, and so on. He is much sought-after by his customers, due to the quality of the products he sells. To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, Soumaïla decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about a year ago. After successfully repaying his two earlier loans, he is now on his third. This loan will allow him to buy 15 packs of varied cigarettes, five bags of sugar, 12 boxes of tea, 10 packs of candies, 10 packs of chewing gum, 12 packets of matches and eight boxes of soap.  He buys his merchandise from wholesale traders in the city, before reselling them in his store. 
 
With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 175,000 francs CFA, which will mainly be used to increase his working capital, contribute to covering the household expenses, and pay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy various store items.

loans.name: Sugey Marina

texts.es: Sugey con su previo credikiva compró calzado, cosméticos, productos de platería y ropa, todo esto respondiendo a pedidos solicitados por sus clientes en su tarea de preventa. Con ello se benefició mucho, porque obtuvo mayor liquidez, incrementó sus ventas y las utilidades de su negocio. Su inversión del credikiva, al que en la actualidad aplica, es en mercancía con la que viene trabajando, pues la conoce muy bien y sabe donde encontrar los mejores precios, con los cuales atraer a su clientela. Ella comprará ropa, calzado accesorios femeninos, cosméticos artículos de plata, con lo que vestirá a su clientela, para que estos alegres reciban las navidades y el año nuevo.
texts.en:
Sugey's previous microloan was used to buy footwear, cosmetics, silver items, and clothing, all of which were items previously ordered by her customers in her business of sales of catalog goods.  With this loan, she benefited greatly by increasing her liquidity.  She increased her sales and the profits of her business.  

Her investment of the microloan that she is currently applying for will be in the good that she has continued to sell, since she has a lot of knowledge of these goods and where to find the best prices, with which she can better attract customers.  She will buy clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, and silver jewelry to deck out her customers so that they can have a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year's.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, feminine accessories, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: El Sr. Demetrio tiene 46 años, casado tiene cuatro hijos de las edades de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años, el  se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es chapista hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la zona de Cota Cota al sur de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Demetrio  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de herramientas y materiales y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Demetrio va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, Demetrio  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única  actividad que tiene para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Demetrio is 46 years old. He is married and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12, and 10. He works repairing cars. He has done body work for a number of years. His workshop is located in the Cota Cota zone in the south of the city of La Paz, where he offers his services. This loan is his second one with this institution. Sr.Demetrio is going to use this loan to purchase tools and materials and thus offer better service to his customers and increase his earnings. His reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in his work. Sr. Demetrio is going to use the earnings to continue buying tools to continue outfitting his workshop. Demetrio is a very hard-working person. He feels happy about the opportunity offered [by the loan], since this is the only activity he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy tools and material for car repairs

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est camerounais de 36 marié et père de 04 enfants. Il a ouvert et gère un mini atelier de soudure depuis près de 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Grâce à sa technicité et son dynamisme, il a su fidéliser une clientèle de plus en plus exigeante. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de matières premieres (fers,plaques métalliques...) et de matériels (scie, pinces...) pour satisfaire à temps ces clients. Il souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et injecter une autre partie dans les besoins (nutrition et éducation) de sa famille.
texts.en: Patrice is a 36 year old Cameroonian. He is married and the father of four children. He opened and has managed a mini welding studio for nearly three years in an area of the city. Thanks to his technical nature and his dynamism, he knew how to make his customers faithful and increasingly demanding. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of raw materials (iron, metallic plaques) and materials (saw, pliers) to satisfy his customers on time. He wishes to reinvest his profits in his business in order to grow it and use another part of his profits for the nutritional and educational needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy iron, metallic plaques, a saw and pliers.

loans.name: Jenny Senovia

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny se dedica a la elaboración de tarjetas  para distintas fechas especiales, como para el día de la madre el día del amor del estudiante del Padre, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito que lo utilizo en la elaboracion de sus tarjetas, en esta ocacion  la Sra. Jenny solicita este credito para la compra de material como cartulinas y goma eva para la elaboracion de tarjetas navideñas ya que se acerca esta epoca donde tiene mucha demanda, y tiene muchos pedidos que entregar.
texts.en: Jenny works making cards for various special holidays, like Mother's Day, Student's Day, and Father's Day.  She says that everything went well with her previous loan that she used for making her cards.  On this occasion, Jenny is requesting a loan to buy material, like pasteboard and decorative foam paper for making Christmas cards; this Christmas season is coming up and there is always a lot demand and she has many orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy materials, like pasteboard and decorative foam paper.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.fr: Celestine est une camerounaise de 41 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants dont les ages sont 7 et 6 ans. elle possède une mini boutique où elle vend des vetements depuis 2 ans dans un coin de la ville. Grâce à sa determination et à son dynamisme, elle a su fidéliser une bonne partie de son voisnage et augmenter graduellement cette clientèle au point où elle ressent le besoin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. ce credit lui permettra de renforcer son stock avec des vetements tels que l'afritude, les gants, les vetements pour femme et hommes etc...les bénéfices ainsi réalisés seront reinvestis dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et affectés dans l'assouvissement des besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Celestine is a 41 year old Cameroonian. She is a single mother of two children, aged 6 and 7 years. She has a mini store where she has sold clothing for two years in an area of the city. Thanks to her determination and dynamism, she knew how to make a good number of her neighbors into faithful customers and gradually increased her customer base to the point where she feels the need to increase her merchandise stock. This loan will allow her to reinforce her stock with clothing such as Afritude brand clothing, gloves, clothing for women and men, etc. The profits thus made will be reinvested in her business in order to grow it and used to satisfy her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her store.

loans.name: Safora

texts.fr:
Madame Safora a 29 ans, marie et mère de 2 enfants, elle réside chez son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Madame Safora est gestionnaire de formation,  qui après ses études s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis maintenant trois années. Avec une telle expérience dans un domaine, elle est très sollicitée par des jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, anniversaire, etc.). L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter, 20 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités, 30 boites de gels et une douzaine de vernis de couleurs différentes à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce deuxième prêt, un bénéfice moyen 100.000 FCFA lui permettant de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Safora is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She resides at her husband place in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso City. Ms. Safora is an administrator by training. After her studies, she soon became familiar with styling women's hair three years ago. With such experience in this domain, she is much in demand by young single women, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, anniversaries, etc.) 

Having insufficient resources of her own for carrying out her work is the reason for her goal and the justification for this request for a Soro Yiriwaso loan, so as to do better satisfying the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She is requesting this initial loan to increase her working capital to be able to purchase 20 packets of hair extensions of different qualities, 30 containers of gel, and a dozen of fingernail polish of different colors, in Bamako.

With this loan, she envisions making an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA enabling her to address most of her costs, help cover family expenses, pay the loan interest, and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase packets of hair extensions, gels, and fingernail polish

loans.name: Chicas Lindas Group

texts.es:
El comité Chicas Lindas son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo, son 14 integrantes, todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras, se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problemita del grupo,  ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas para que así puedan salir adelante juntas.
La Presidenta, la Sra.  Justina por ejemplo es una persona muy trabajadora, que por medio de la venta de cosméticos está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia con todo lo que puede y tiene a su alcance. Ella solicito de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, y de esa forma seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Chicas Lindas” (Beautiful Girls) has 14 members who are all from the District of San Lorenzo. They are responsible and hardworking mothers who always come together whenever they need to resolve problems in their group or find opportunities to help their community. In addition, they want to move forward together.

The group president, Sra. Justina, is an example of a hardworking individual. Through her business of selling cosmetics, she has been able to move forward and help her family. She now has everything she needs at her disposal. Justina is requesting a loan so that she can buy cosmetics of all types. This will enable her to continue providing a wide variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Magali

texts.en: Magali is a single mother of a six-year-old boy with special needs. She came from the Dominican Republic seven years ago with a clear goal of becoming a productive citizen. Her son started the Early Intervention Program at the age of two, so she needed to work in something that allowed her to be at home caring for her son.  She has always been passionate about education and knew that she wanted to do something in that field, so she decided to open a home-based daycare service. She was able to procure all the necessary licenses and the business has been in service for three years now. She currently cares for 17 kids and employs two women who help her care for the children. Magali looks after her business with passion and dedication because she wants to give the children the same quality care that she gives her own child.  Magali is also studying part-time at a local community college in the Bronx, majoring in Early Childhood Education. Her goal is to finish her studies and open a full service day care center. Magali is asking for a loan to help her buy new material and equipment for her home-based business, which will increase the quality of the service she offers. Some of the things she needs are a desktop computer to help school-age children with their homework and for her to be able to do the daily menu online; new tables, chairs and beds.

loans.use: to buy a computer, tables, chairs and beds for her day care center

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to buy a full truck of charcoal instead of contributing with other retailers and to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
María, quiere incrementar el negocio en el numero de cerdos, tambien mejorar la infraestructura, ella se comprara materiales de construcción como bloques, laminas, cemento, madera, para la construcción de una galera donde puedan estar los cerdos.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue bueno, compro cerdos y ahora tiene en cuenta 12 en total para engorde, esto ha mejorado sus ingresos  para los gastos familiares.
texts.en: María wants to buy more pigs for her business and remodel the farm buildings. She wil buy construction materials like cement blocks, sheet steel, cement, and wood for the pig pen. Her previous loan was a success; she bought pigs and now has 12 to fatten so that she can earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sheet steel, cement, and wood for the farm.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, él se dedica a administrar un chalet y un taller de mecanica automotriz, estos negocios los inicio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos, los horarios de atención son de 6:00am a 7:00pm, en el chalet su esposa le ayuda a atender los clientes.
Él quiere invertir en el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para poder fortalecer de mercadería el negocio, boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, y mas mercadería que es necesaria para que el negocio se encuentre con mas capacidad, esto le permitirá tener un mejor negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Su aspiración con el negocio es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife, but they have no children. He manages a sales kiosk and an auto repair shop. These businesses were started out of necessity so that he would have a source of income. His hours of operation are from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. At the sales kiosk, his wife helps with attending to the customers.

Luis wants to invest in his business, so he is requesting a loan to strengthen his inventory. He will buy snack foods, cookies, sodas, juices, and other items that he needs for his business so that it will have more capacity. This will result in an improvement in his business and an increase of his sales. His wish is that his business will result in a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, cookies, sodas, juices, and other items.

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es:
Claudia, necesita dinero para invertir en el cultivo de maíz, comprando 4 sacos de abono y pagar mano de obra ya que le podrá realizar una nueva siembra, de la cual espera tener una buena cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, aumento la capacidad del terreno, no tuvo ningún problema para realizar el trabajo, hasta el momento ha mejorado sus situación económica gracias a la inversión Kiva.
texts.en:
Claudia needs money to invest in growing corn, to buy four sacks of fertilizer and to pay for labor.  She wants to be able to plant again, and hopes to have a good harvest.

The previous loan had a positive effect.  She increased the capacity of her plot of land, and had no problem doing her work.  Up to the present her economic situation has improved because of the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, necesita realizar un nuevo préstamo, ya que continua vendiendo tortillas y  se comprara nuevamente los productos que utiliza como maíz y leña, con los fondos prestados logra mantener su negocio por un tiempo.
Su efecto con el préstamo anterior en el negocio, manifiesta que le permitió tener mas capacidad para atender la clientela, sus ingresos han ido superándose, gracias a la inversión ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en: Juana needs another loan because she is still selling tortillas and has to buy more supplies like corn and wood. With the loan, she will be able to keep her business going for a while. Her previous loan allowed her to serve more customers, to increase her income, and to improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en: Daylin is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Daylin is married and has five children. To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does fishing. She has been in her business for five years and earns PHP 2,000 a month from these activities. This year, Daylin joined GDMPC. Daylin is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000, which will be used to repair her husband's fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and other materials for making jackets

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mis Sueños” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de moda y confección desde hace 50 años, confecciona específicamente buzos (para colegios), faldas, poleras, blusas, vestidos de novia y vestidos de gala, trabaja en conjunto con su hija, habilitó un parte de su casa como taller y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos  que  va necesitando como géneros, telas polar, accesorios varios para las costuras y confección lo encuentra  en la cuidad de Santiago donde encuentra todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará elásticos, agujas, géneros, tela polar, pique, blonda.
Una de las metas de Maria es tener un bazar en su casa, donde pueda incluir otro tipo de mercadería y a la vez realizando sus costuras y confecciones, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y darle un buen pasar a la familia.
Maria vive junto a su hija, quien trabaja con ella en las costuras y confecciones. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un bazar donde atienda a su clientela de forma más tranquila y vender otros productos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza
texts.en:
Maria is part of the Communal Bank “Mis Sueños” (My Dreams) belonging to the city of Talca.
