Altangerel is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase cattle used to increase production of his organic dairy products. He is a welcoming and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase cattle used to increase production of his organic dairy products.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en: Aquilina is 64 years old and married with three children. She works very hard running a general store in the Philippines to provide for them. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, curls, detergents and other grocery items.  She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Aquilina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina, 59 years old, is from the small village of Zestaponi district. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren (12 and 15 years old). Nina and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Her grandchildren go to school. They are orphans and are provided with an orphan pension from the local government. The family lives in poverty. The family's only income is from agricultural activities. In particular, Nina has two milk cows and four sheep, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, she owns 0.5 hectare land and grows different kinds of vegetables. Nina sells the harvested products and cheese locally in an open market. She works hard to insure good harvest. 
Nina requested a loan for purchasing building materials to build a new house. Their existing house is wooden and is much damaged. It’s impossible for family members to spend winter months in such conditions as they can’t install any kind of heating system. Nina wants to create a warm and comfortable environment for the family. She needs building materials for continuing the building process as the foundation of the house is already laid. After the house is built, the family will be able to live in a more comfortable environment and warmly spend the winter. Nina and her orphans await your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materilas and build a new house.

loans.name: Amanhan

texts.en: Amanhan is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in a small house in the Bayan-Olgii province of Mongolia. He has been working as an assistant in a private construction company for years now. His wife gave birth to their son and stays home with the young child. His older son, Daurjan, is 5 years old and goes to kindergarten. Amanhan is now planning to open a butcher shop because at this time of year the price of cattle and meat products is lowest. So he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase cattle from herders and sell the meat to customers at a retail counter which he has already ordered in the local market. He has been helping his parents to breed cattle since he was a child, so he knows lot about cattle and meat production. He is a hardworking, honest man.

loans.use: to purchase cattle from herders

loans.name: Osman Calla's Group

texts.en: Teachers of the AL-Harrkan Islamic Secondary School are very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan they received. With the help of that loan, some of the teachers were able to pay school fees for their children. Others invested the loan in petty businesses and some bought pieces of land/house building materials. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further improve their lives. Henry this time is the leader of this group. Born 46 years ago in Makeni city, Henry is married to a housewife and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Henry has been in the teaching profession for many years now. He has requested this loan to buy house-building materials like bags of cement, for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like bags of cements, for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for their livestock business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, 32, lives with her life partner and their children. She sells fruits and vegetables: lettuce, tomatoes, chiles, carrots, kale, cucumbers, cabbages, oranges, and other produce. She has been a merchant for nine months and has gained the sales experience necessary to increase her profits. Her shop is in her home and serves her neighborhood. She has regular customers because she is well-known. People prefer to shop with her because she always has what they need, her quality is good, her prices are affordable, and her service is excellent.

Saumu is active, dedicated to her work, and has many goals. She works very hard each day to reach these goals and, thus, to achieve success. Like every good merchant, she wants to grow her business and make new investments. She needs capital to do so and has applied for a loan with Yehu to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, bananas, and kale, amongst other produce.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, bananas, and kale, amongst other produce.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Bernardita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice business. Bernardita is borrowing 29000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and fertilizers for her farm.

Bernardita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura  tiene 42 años está casada con David, con quien tiene 5 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre 20 y 1 año. Laura y su familia viven bajo un techo propio en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Laura es laboriosa. Las actividades de Laura son varias, atiende su hogar y familia para que ellos también inicien sus actividades diarias. Al culminar sus labores del hogar, se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivos.
Actualmente cuenta con 3 lotes de tierras fértiles, en ellas siembra achiote, coco, café, y cítricos como tanyelos y naranjas. 
En estos días el precio de sus productos es bajo. Por ello se esmera en el cultivo de otras plantas que sembró hace poco.
Gracias a su esfuerzo puede asegurar el alimento, vestido y educación de sus hijos. Sus metas más cercanas son ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar su producción, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de terrenos y abonos. Ahora piensa adquirir fertilizantes para sus cultivos de achiote, café y cítricos, que piensa cosechar el próximo año. Éste es su préstamo número 4 que obtiene de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo antes. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo sólido y trabajador.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir de 15 bolsas de abono orgánico como el de guano de ave de corral para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Laura is 42 years old and is married to David, with whom he has five children aged between 20 and one year old. Laura and her family live under their own roof in a native community of the central jungle. Laura is laborious. The activities of Laura are varied, she takes care of her home and family so they can also begin their daily activities. 

When she finishes her chores, she takes care of her land. Currently, she has three lots of fertile land, where she grows achiote, coconut, coffee and citrus fruits such as tangelos and oranges. In these days, the price of her products is low. For this reason, she tries hard in growing other plants she recently planted. Thanks to her effort she can ensure food, clothing and education for her children.

Her short term goals are to expand her croplands and to improve her production. To do that, she needs to invest in the purchase of land and fertilizers. She now hopes to buy fertilizer for her crops of achiote, coffee and citrus plants, which she expects to harvest next year.

This is her loan number four from MFP. She promises to be punctual in paying her monthly installments, like before. Her communal bank is called "Los productores Inchatingari" and she is happy to be part of a solid and hard-working group. With the 1000 soles she will be able to buy 15 bags of compost such as poultry manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like Nomi, wheat flour, sugar, wool and many other things

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush is a 20-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Vilik, in Goris town. Both Haykush and her husband are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock: cows, a calf and oxen. With the help of the loan, Hayksuh is planning to increase the livestock by buying two more cows. She wants to purchase these cows for milking purposes. She hopes that the sales of milk will bring her high income and she will be able to cover her young family’s costs.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Sarmen

texts.en: Sarmen is 25-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and two children in Tegh village of Syunik region. He works at one of the local military units as a storekeeper. Besides his work he also runs a farm. He keeps livestock and has a plot of land where he cultivates wheat and barley. The loan will help Sarmen to increase the livestock by purchasing eight calves. This will allow Sarmen to earn more income from cattle breeding and ensure a better life for his young family.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, Virginie est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 22ans et 16ans. Elle a une grande boutique où elle vend des sacs de riz, des boîtes de conserve, de macaroni, des liqueurs et de divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Virginie, age 47, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 22 and 16 years old, respectively.

Virginie runs a large shop where she has been selling bags of rice, canned foods, macaroni and liquors for a few years.  She buys her goods from a market in Benin and a market in another country.

Eager to boost her purchasing power and to fulfill her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev.  Her goal is to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of rice, 12 bottles of liquor, 1/2 box of macaroni and 2 boxes of canned food.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, four of whom are attending school. She does not look after any other family members.

Syliva has been selling snacks in a retail shop for ten years, working six days a week. She has rental houses as another source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock flour, cooking oil, baking powder and charcoal for making the snacks. Her challenges include thieves, seasonality and recovering money from clients who take the snacks on credit. Her dream is to be able to expand the business. Sylvia joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charge on loans. She lives in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more flour, cooking oil, baking powder and charcoal

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 48 ans mariée, mère de 7 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 21 ans tous vont à l'école. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle vend des vivres frais (manioc, patate...) en fonction des saisons depuis 20 ans. iSon activité  fonctionne, sa clientèle s'accroit au fil du temps et elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son  capital. D'où l'importance de ce crédit en ce moment pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter les stocks de marchandises (sacs de manioc et patate). les bénéfices générés par ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux beoins de sa famille dont elle en a la charge.
texts.en: Madeleine is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children between the ages of 9 and 21, all of whom are in school. She is a vendor in a marketplace and has sold seasonal fresh produce (cassava, potatoes, etc.,) for the last 20 years. As her clientele grows, she is no longer able to satisfy their growing demand with her current stock. Therefore, this loan is important as it will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise (bags of cassava and potatoes.) The profits generated by this loan will be in part reinvested to grow the business, and the rest will help her support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 55 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. Cecilia has been in this business for 37 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who goes to school. Cathy takes care of one additional family member. 

To earn a living Cathy sells milk in a shop that she rents, on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 3 years working six days a week.  

Cathy has requested a loan of UGX200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more milk and bread for resale. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspiration are to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bread for resale.

loans.name: Dianela

texts.en:
Dianela is 48 years old and married with one child. Dianela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dianela has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income as an Avon dealer and and from an eLoading business.

Dianela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Bisel

texts.es:
Bisel de 41 años, convive con Betty, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa rústica ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Bisel se dedica a la agricultura, produce café, achiote, naranjas, y plátanos en 3 lotes de terrenos que su localidad les otorgó.
“Gracias al plátano podemos cubrir los gastos diarios. Cosechamos a la semana 70 kilos y lo vendemos a 80 céntimos cada uno”, comenta, afirmando la rentabilidad de este producto.
El café y el achiote son frutos que más satisfacciones le dan, por eso se esmera mucho en sus cuidados, para cosecharlos una vez al año.
Cuando sus cultivos están atendidos, él trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas. 
Gracias al trabajo coordinado puede mantener a su numerosa familia brindándole los servicios básicos. Ahora quiere adquirir otros terrenos de cultivos para multiplicar su producción, pues les agrada el trabajo del campo, pero antes tiene pensado fertilizar sus cultivos para las cosechas del próximo año. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Productores Inchatingari”, y le agrada trabajar con personas serias y responsables.
Con el dinero comprará bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de achiote y café.
texts.en:
Bisel for 41 years old, lives with Betty, with whom he has 6 children. They live in a rustic home located in a native community in the central jungle. 

Bisel makes a living from agriculture; produces coffee, annatto, oranges, and bananas in 3 lots of land that their locality gave them. 

"Thanks to the banana, we can cover the daily expenses. We reap 70 kilos a week, which we sell at 80 cents each," says, affirming the profitability of this product. The coffee and the annatto are the fruits that give him more satisfaction. This is why strives much in their care and harvest them once a year. 

When he has taken care of his crops, he works as a laborer on other plots. Thanks to this coordinated work, he can maintain his large family by providing the basic services. Because he likes the work of the field, now, he wants to acquire land for other crops to multiply his production but before he plans to fertilize his crops for next year's harvest. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He gives his word that he will pay punctually all his payments. He belongs to the communal bank "Los Productores Inchatingari", and he likes to work with serious and responsible people.
 
With the money will buy organic fertilizer for his crops of annatto and coffee.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer for his crops of annatto and coffee

loans.name: Munhktsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her two children in their wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital in Mongolia. Her home is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Munkhtsetseg bought the house a couple of months ago. Even though her house is located far from the downtown, she loves it so much. Her children attend a public school. 

Since March, Munkhtsetseg has been working as gas filler in a gas station. Her husband has worked as a contract worker in Korea since 2010, and every month he sends $250 to his family in Mongolia. Every day, Munkhtsetseg and her children ride two types of bus to reach their school and work; they spend three hours a day just on the way. Sometimes they need to wait for the right bus for an hour. She doesn’t want her children to stand waiting for a bus when the outside temperature reaches -20°C so Munkhtsetseg is asking for a 4,000,000 MNT loan to buy a used car that runs on gas. By buying a car, she can take her children to their school and home. Two months ago she received a driver's license.

loans.use: to buy a used-car

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She's always on the lookout for new opportunities that can allow her to achieve success.

Eunice operates a food stall. She is currently asking for a new loan to expand on this business so she will record more profits. She intends to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, vegetables, and meat. 

Eunice has a good payment history and is morally beyond reproach. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and is confident that it will bring greater economic stability to her home. She is happy for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. 

Her previous loan enabled her to have improvements in her business and also her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. 

NWTF is relisting Estelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 34-year-old and lives in Tsav village of Kapan region. She is a mother to 2 children. Her husband, Hunan, works at the local village village-hall as a gatekeeper. 

The couple is involved in agriculture. They keep cows and a calf and they sell the produced milk and meat to the local market traders.  With the requested loan amount Syuzanna is planning to build a greenhouse where she will grow fruits and vegetables. 

This is important for Syuzanna to earn agricultural income during winter, too, and save for implementation of her future plans. Syuzanna wants to found her own store where she will sell fruits and vegetables from her own greenhouse.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

Jeniffer has been selling charcoal and nets from home at retail for the last two years, working six and a half days a week. She has rental houses to earn additional income. She has requested for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal and nets to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her businesses and accumulate profits that will enable her acquire land. 

Jeniffer joined MCDT because there is no relative who can lend her money like MCDT does. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and nets to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 46 years old. She lives in Meghri town with her husband and son. Her son works at a local military union and is the only worker in the family. Rima and her husband, Libik, are involved in agriculture; they keep a cow and an ox. 

Because of not having sufficient funds for expanding the number of livestock, Rima has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she is planning to improve the herd with special milk cows. Rima hopes that she will gather more milk and will be able to sell it to local market traders. The loan is very important for Rima and her family to cover basic needs and live in more prosperous living conditions.

loans.use: to improve the herd with special milk cows.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes de 27 años está casada con Elvis con quien tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural. Lourdes es una madre trabajadora. Desde los 19 años viene laborando para apoyar en la mantención de su familia. Desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería. Principalmente cultiva papas, avena, habas y maca. Pero a veces la siembra le traía problemas, llegando incluso a perder 2 cultivos, producto de las heladas. Por ello decidió empezar con la crianza de animales. Actualmente cuenta con cuyes, ovejas, vacas y toros, los que engorda en un cierto tiempo y después negocia en su misma ciudad. “El ganado vacuno lo llevo hasta Chupaca (ciudad ubicada a 250 Km. de distancia), porque los precios son mejores”, comenta. Realiza este viaje cada 20 días, por ello confirma la rentabilidad de su negocio.
Este mes tiene pensado adquirir 2 vacas, las que engordará para luego venderlas. Solicita de su apoyo por eso. Mientras tanto se dedica a la agricultura y al cuidado de sus animales menores. Ésta es la tercera vez que ella recibe un crédito de MFP, por ello se compromete a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo anteriormente. Con el dinero podrá adquirir 2 vacas, a las que engordará para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Lourdes, who is 27 years old, is married to Elvis with whom she has two children aged nine and four years old. They live in their own house located in a rural annex. Lourdes is a working mother. 

From the age of 19, she has been working to support the maintenance of her family. Since then, she is engaged in farming and ranching. She mainly grows potatoes, oatmeal, beans and maca. But sometimes growing brought her problems, even leading to the lost of two crops due to frosts. For this reason, she decided to start raising animals. Currently, she has guinea pigs, sheep, cows and bulls, which she fattens for a while and then sells in her city.

"I take the cattle to Chupaca (city located 250 km away), because the prices are better", she says. She makes this trip every 20 days, confirming the profitability of her business. This month she plans to buy two cows, which she will fatten and then sell. She is requesting your support to do it.

Meanwhile, she is devoted to farming and to take care of her small animals. This is the third time she receives a loan from MFP. She agrees to pay her monthly installments on time, like before. With the money, she will be able to buy two cows, which she will fatten for resale.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Hotamaly

texts.ru: Хотамали в нашей организации кредитуется второй цикл. Он добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Его сыновья работают в России, но не имеют постоянное место работы, поэтому Хотамали не надеется на денежные переводы сыновей и сам занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур, так как имеет достаточный опыт по скотоводству и земледелием. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень. В ведении данного бизнеса ему помогает жена. Хотамали на полученный урожай покупает скот из базара на низкие цены, его жена на определённое время откармливает скот и перепродают по высокой цене. На полученный доход от бизнеса Хотамали улучшил условию своего домохозяйство. В этом году Хотамали посеял на 2 гектара земли ячменя, однако из-за неблагополучной погоды Хотамали не смог получить ожидаемый урожай. Поэтому он обращался в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки скота и расширить свой бизнес по животноводству. Скот держит за счёт кормов произведённых его самым. Хотамали надеется на Вашу благотворительность.
texts.en:
This is Hotamaly's second loan in our organization. He's a very honest, dedicated and hardworking person. He was born in a country area which is well known for its agrarian industries. His sons work in Russia, however, they don't have stable employment so Hotamaly can't rely on them fully for support. Therefore, he makes a living by growing crops ad raising animals, areas in which he has significant experience. Mainly, he grows wheat and barley.  His wife helps him run his business. 

He uses profits from the crops to purchase cattle for cheap on the market, after which his wife fattens the cattle for a period of time and then they sell it for a high price. Hotamaly spends his income on his household in order to improve his living conditions.

This year, he planted two hectares of land with barley, but was unable to reap a good harvest due to poor weather. Therefore, he approached our organization requesting a loan to buy some cattle and expand his animal raising business. He feeds his cattle with fodder from his fields. 
Hotamaly hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 58 years old and lives in Getap village with his wife and 26-year-old son. The family is involved in agriculture and they keep cows, chickens and oxen. Samvel also has an orchard where he grows apples, pears, peaches, apricots and nut trees with great love and care.
 
Samvel applied for this loan as he wants to increase his livestock by purchasing a calf, cow and feed. He hopes that by improving his herd with special milk cows he will be able to increase sales of milk and meat and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, a cow and their feed.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de venta de comida,la socia vende ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limon que lleva camote,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La solicita el credito para comprar pescado,limon y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Delfina continues to make her living selling food, namely selling ceviche which is a marinated seafood dish made with fish, lemon and sweet potatoes. She sells in the street from 8 am to 6 pm, which she has been doing this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Delfina's dream is to have a restaurant. She is seeking this loan to buy fish, lemon and sweet potatoes. Delfina is pleased about the loan and promises to meet the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy fish, lemon and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar de 26 años es un joven independiente y muy trabajador, aún sin una familia propia ha logrado forjarse un futuro de trabajo y muchos objetivos por cumplir, producto de ello es propietario de su casa hecha a base de madera. Lleva 3 años realizando actividades agrícolas, teniendo como principal producto el cacao y café orgánico. Es así que desempeña ésta actividad en una parcela que adquirió hace algunos años con el apoyo de sus padres y desde entonces puede solventar algunos gastos familiares debido a que ellos ya se encuentran en una edad avanzada.
Desarrolla su actividad en muchas ocasiones solo y en otras con apoyo de jornaleros que logra contratar siendo en muchas ocasiones sus primos y amigos. Considera su actividad muy beneficiosa puesto que la calidad de cacao que producen sus tierras son óptimas y bien cotizadas por los acopiadores haciendo de su labor muy reconfortante y remunerativa, no obstante el recolectar los frutos de cacao que va cosechando es casi un dilema por hallarse sus parcelas en un terreno muy desnivelado. No ajeno a la temporada de sembrado y mantenimiento de los árboles de cacao, desea contar con sacos de abono orgánico y realizar nuevamente la contrata de jornaleros para remover una parte de las tierras de su terreno con el objetivo de volverlas un tanto mas productivas.
A futuro desea acumular capital para lograr iniciarse en el negocio de abarrotes para así ocupar su tiempo mientras espera el mantenimiento periódico que necesitan sus plantaciones. Este es su quinto crédito, esta muy comprometido con el tema del cumplimiento y la responsabilidad. Le agrada mucho ser parte de su banco comunal por estar conformado por personas muy responsables que hacen del ahorro una buena herramienta de progreso.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la contrata de jornaleros para remover parte del terreno de sus parcelas así como el mantenimiento a sus árboles de cacao.
texts.en:
Cesar, 26, is an independent and very hard working young man. Even though he does not have his own family, he has managed to forge a career future and many objectives to fulfill, a product of which is owning his house made of wood. He has three years experience doing farming work, having cocoa and organic coffee as his main product. He works at this job in a parcel of land that he acquired some years ago with the support of his parents and, since then, he has been able to pay some family bills since they are already at an advanced age.

He develops his work on many occasions alone and on others with the support of workers who he manages to hire often being his cousins and friends. He considers his work to be very beneficial since the quality of cocoa that his land produces is optimal and well quoted by collectors doing their very rewarding and profitable work. However, harvesting the cocoa is almost a dilemma since his parcels are found on very uneven land. Not foreign to the planting season and maintenance of the cocoa trees, he wishes to have bags of organic fertilizer and hire workers again to remove a part of the land on his land with the objective of making them more productive.

In the future, he wishes to accumulate capital to start a grocery business to occupy his time while he waits for the periodic maintenance that his plantations require. This is his fifith loan. He is very committed to compliance and responsibility. He is thankful to be part of his community bank made up of very responsible people who make savings a good tool for progress. With the 1,000 new "soles" he will hire workers to remove a part of land on his land and therefore maintain his cocoa trees.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Construyendo Sueños Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Construyendo sueños con Esperanza” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de empanadas, venta de lencería, venta de perfumes, venta de joyas de plata, feriantes, venta de ropa, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Casablanca, ubicada en la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Mirtha, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color blanca, chaqueta de color café, jeans, su cabello es de color castaño claro, lo usa largo y suelto, en sus piernas tiene una cartera de color café y verde estilo artesanal.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa específicamente ropa de casa, lencería desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja vendiendo ropa por catalogo y los ofrece en colegios, jardines infantiles, vecinos, amigos y familiares, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, donde encuentra gran variedad de ropa y novedades para ofrecer a su clientela a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de lencería, cobertores, sabanas, almohadones, juegos de toallas, cortinas de baño.
Una de las metas de Mirtha es instalar un local cerca del centro de donde vive, donde pueda exhibir toda su mercadería y atender de manera mas cómoda, así generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
Mirtha vive junto a su marido. Sus sueños  a nivel laboral es crecer y vender cada dia mucha más mercadería, y a nivel personal ser independiente en su rubro.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Casablanca es una comuna de la provincia de Valparaíso, ubicada en la región del mismo nombre. Tiene un clima de tipo mediterráneo, con veranos de sequía prolongada y lluvias invernales cortas, pero muy fuertes. El nombre “Casablanca” proviene del siglo XVI cuando existía “una casa de muros blanquecinos“ sobre una loma ubicada a un costado de uno de sus caminos más antiguos, llamado camino real de carretas. 
Actualmente su economía se basa en servicios, agricultura, transporte, agroindustria, turismo, comercio.
texts.en:
This community  bank is called "Building Dreams with Hope." It consists of 19 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different areas among which are; selling pies, lingerie, perfume, silver jewelry, market sellers, selling clothing, among other services. They all belong to the district of Casablanca, located in the city of Valparaiso.

Mirtha is a member of the community bank who in the picture is sitting in the front row, ranking second from right to left, wearing a white colored shirt, brown jacket, jeans. Her hair is light brown, long and loose. On her legs is a green and brown bag in a craftsmanship style. She sells clothing specifically linen for 2 years. She comments that she works selling clothes by catalog and offers in schools, kindergartens, to neighbors, friends and family, working from Monday to Saturday and distributes her schedule according to their availability.

The merchandise that she is going to need to buy in the city of Santiago, where she finds a variety of clothing and novelties to offer to customers at low-cost and  therefore economically desirable. With the loan, she will buy lingerie clothes, blankets, sheets, pillows, towel sets, shower curtains. One of Mirtha's goals is to install a shop near the center of where she lives, where she can display all her goods and serve more comfortably and therefore generate more income and improve the quality of life.

Mirtha lives with her husband. His dreams at a working level are to grow and sell a lot more merchandise every day, and  at a personal level be independent in her field. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza, since they will allow you to invest in her business. 

With respect to the community bank group that she's part of, she says that in it there is very good communication. Furthermore the training, have helped her learn new sales strategies and accounting.

Casablanca is a community in the province of Valparaiso, located in the region of the same name. It has a Mediterranean climate, with prolonged summers of drought and short  but very strong winter rains. The name "Casablanca" comes from the sixteenth century when there was "a house of whitish walls" on a hill located on the side of one of its oldest roads, called royal road of carts. Today its economy is based on services, agriculture, transportation, agribusiness, tourism, and trade.

loans.use: to buy lingerie, blankets, sheets, pillows, towel sets, shower curtains.

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en:
Amarbayasgalan is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in small house in Mongolia's Orhon Province. Her husband Tumenbayar, 44, is a construction engineer and also helps her operate her shoemaking business during the winter. Her son Anhbayar, 18, is a university student in Russia with scholarship, and her 2 daughters, Enhjin and Nomin, are secondary school students. She and her husband take care of their children and are very concerned about their children's education. She has been operating her shoemaking business since 1998. She has built strong relationships with her customers, who trust her deeply. 

Amarbayasgalan is requesting a loan of 3,900,000 MNT to purchase inventory and a sewing machine to start producing felt home slippers for her customers during winter. She is a friendly, open-minded and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and a sewing machine for her shoemaking business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is proactive young woman who lives in Meghri with her mother and 8-year-old son. Besides her work as an operator at a local company, Susanna also manages the household and helps her mother to run a farm. They keep cows and grow apples, apricots, and peaches. As Susanna is the only breadwinner in the family, it is very difficult for her to cover the family's daily costs. With the requested amount, Susanna is planning to improve the farm with a special milk cow. This cow will help her to earn more income and ensure a better future for her son.

loans.use: to  improve the farm with a special milk cow.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is taking out another loan to make new investments. She would like to expand her charcoal-selling business because she has noticed that it is a profitable business. She also has noticed that she gets more sales during the rainy season. Mejumaa therefore wants to take this advantage since it is now winter season, when it normally rains heavily.She is asking for this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 34-year-old divorced woman with 2 children. She lives in Aygezard village, in Ararat Province, with her 11-year-old son and 10-year-old daughter. Agriculture is the sole financial income for this family. Anna keeps an orchard where she grows pears, apples and peaches with great pleasure and love. She also keeps a grape orchard. 

Anna has applied for this loan in order to purchase wires and stakes for her grape orchard. Anna hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to gather a good harvest of grapes to sell to the wineries and local traders. The loan will help Anna to earn additional income, cover her household costs and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for wires and stakes for her grape orchard.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice has shown great desire to move forward, which none can take for granted. She is happy to see that the loans she has received from Yehu and Kiva have been of great help both to her business and her family's well-being. She is asking for a new loan to make a new investment. She wants to buy more fruits and vegetables. This will enable her to continue earning income and providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of  8,300,000 Sierra Leone Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they can meet certain financial challenges that cannot be met with their salaries alone. And at the end of each month, they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Khalie is the featured leader of this group of teachers. The 42-year-old is a native of Rokupr village, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and the couple has 5 children  who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Khalie has been in the teaching profession for 17 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida works hard to support her family. Nelida is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Nelida requested a 21000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

Nelida has been in this business for 30 years now. She also earns additional income from rice retailing and general store businesses.

In the future, Nelida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Smbat

texts.en: Smbat is 20-year-old proactive young man. He lives with his parents in Goris, Armenia. Smbat is engaged in agriculture and is the only breadwinner in the family. He keeps 8 cows, a calf, and 40 sheep. Despite his young age, Smbat has big plans for the future and is working hard to achieve his goals and ensure a better life for his parents. Smbat has applied for this loan to purchase 2 cows and 10 sheep. The loan is very important for him because an increase of his livestock will give him an opportunity to earn more income and implement his future plans.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and 10 sheep.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old and lives with her children in the rural area of Samburu. She is a single mother because of widowhood. Josephine operates a cafe, which is a business that has a lot of demand, but she has a lot of competition. This is why Josephine is requesting a loan from Yehu. She wants to  have a ready stock of vegetables, flour, basic grains, and other ingredients. 

Josephine has good references from her neighbors and is very respectful and hardworking. She has a great desire to succeed and live well with her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, flour, basic grains, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Juliana works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ice candy.  Juliana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros is 35-year-old father of 2 children. He lives in Mayisyan village of Ararat region and his family consists of 5 members: his mother, father, wife and 2 sons. Being the only breadwinner of such big family makes Martiros work hard in order to cover the family’s basic needs. 

He works at the local military unit but unfortunately his salary is not enough to sustain his family, so he is also involved in agriculture. He keeps 2 cows, 7 oxen and 30 chickens. In order to expand the number of livestock Martiros has applied for this loan to purchase 2 oxen and forage for feeding them. This loan is very important for Martiros as it will help him to secure the future of his family and ensure better living conditions for his 2 sons.

loans.use: to pay for 2 oxen and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling seafood. Lucia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is a 32-year-old young man who lives with his mother in Sardarapat village of Armavir region. He works at the local village hall and also helps his mother with agriculture. They keep an orchard with peach, apricot, plum and grape trees.  

He has applied for this loan to build a greenhouse where he is planning to cultivate tomato, haricot and cucumber.  He also needs some financial investments to buy a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, tomato and cucumber seeds and also fuel to heat the greenhouse. The loan is very important for Gegham to undertake all the necessary work processes, increase his agricultural income and secure his family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en: Hrant is a 24-year-old. He lives with his sister and father. The only income of the family comes from agriculture. They keep 8 pigs and 30 sows and cultivate tomatoes as well.  With the requested amount, Hrant will purchase barley seeds for cultivation. He is sure that with the help of this loan he will have a good harvest and will be able to sell barley during the next season. The loan is very important for Hrant and his family to be financially stable and to make ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for barley seeds.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 26 years old and married with two children.  With both her children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, noodles, bread and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 56 years old and married with four children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

Editha has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising ducks.

Editha aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie lives at Buchanan with her husband and two children between the ages of 8 and  14, who    are   attending  school. She is 40 years old and stopped her education in the fifth grade. For the  past twelve   years she has been selling cooking oil, rice, pepper, Vita, onions ,palm oil, salt, and many other  items. She   learned  to  sell  from  her  friend. With  the  profit  generated  from the  business, she buys  more  goods  and  contributes to the  expenses of the family. She is requesting a loan to  purchase more cooking oil, rice, onions, Vita, palm oil,  and salt for the business.  Her plan for the  future is to educate  her children.

loans.use: to  purchase more cooking oil, rice, onions, Vita, palm oil,  and salt for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children; five of them attend school. She does not look after any other family members.

She has been selling charcoal from home at retail for two years and works seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
 
She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to start selling green bananas as well. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Paterna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Paterna has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Paterna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Paterna would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of ten children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for more than 15 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to produce a good harvest from the farm, thus increasing their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Gelacio

texts.es:
De 34 años Gelacio, radica en la zona del Valle del Río Apurimac región Ayacucho, comparte una vida conyugal con Rosana de 30 años, complementan su alegría familiar a lado de sus dos hijos. Para comodidad de su familia logró comprar una vivienda hecha a base de madera. Desde muy niño fue muy colaborador con sus padres en las diversas actividades y tareas del campo consistentes en la producción de diversos productos entre los cuales destaca el producto de mayor producción en la zona como es el cacao, luego de alcanzar edad suficiente y establecer una relación formal con Rosana se inició de manera independiente recibiendo una herencia material por parte de sus padres, conformado por parcelas con árboles de cacao orgánicos, es así como desde hace 8 años ha logrado consolidarse como un gran productor de la zona al igual que muchos pobladores.
Durante estos años ha tenido tanto buenos como malos momentos de los cuales resalta el ataque de una plaga de insectos, que en más de una ocasión arruinó sus cultivos obligando a renovar de manera integral sus plantaciones. Actualmente se encuentra ingresando a una nueva etapa de producción inicial de árboles de cacao, es cuando se debe tomar todas las medidas necesarias para garantizar una producción final de calidad, los requisitos impensables incluyen contar con sacos de abonó orgánico el cual es mas conocido como guano de ave de isla, adicional a ello reservar dinero suficiente para la contrata de jornaleros quienes serán de gran ayuda para al mantenimiento y deshierbo de los árboles. Tiene la grata alegría de ser éste su primer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido y a la vez comprometido con el pago de sus cuotas, espera a futuro seguir perteneciendo a su banco comunal para así a futuro lograr un buen historial crediticio que le permita acceder a un crédito mayor, desde ya agradece a sus compañeros por la acogida brindada.
Con los 500 nuevos soles otorgados espera complementar su capital para contratar jornaleros y comprar de sacos de abono orgánico ocmo guano de ave de isla.
texts.en:
34-year-old Gelacio lives in the El Valle del Río Apurimac area of Ayacucho region.  He lives together with his wife, 30-year-old Rosana, and they live happily together as a family alongside their two children.  For the comfort of his family, Gelacio managed to buy a house made from wood.

From the time he was a very young boy, Gelacio was a lot of help to his parents in their many farming activities and tasks, helping them to grow a variety of produce including the most widely-grown crop in the region: cacao.  When he came of age and settled down in a formal relationship with Rosana, Gelacio started receiving his own material inheritance from his parents consisting of plots of land containing organic cacao trees.  As a result, for the past eight years he has been a large producer in his area, in common with many other local people.

Over the years, Gelacio has experienced both good and bad moments.  One which particularly stands out is when his crops were attacked by a plague of insects.  On more than one occasion this has ruined his crops and forced him to completely re-new his plantings.  Gelacio is currently starting a new stage of planting new cacao trees.  At this time, he must take all necessary measures to ensure a good-quality yield.  One of his needs is to acquire sacks of organic fertilizer (bird guano).  He also needs to put to one side enough money to be able to hire day laborers who will be a great help to him in maintaining his crops and weeding around his trees.  

Gelacio is happy to be requesting his first loan from MFP.  He feels grateful and committed to making his repayments.  He hopes, in the future, to continue belonging to his community bank so that he can build up a good credit history which will allow him to apply for a larger loan.  He thanks his fellow bank members for the welcome they have given him.

Gelacio hopes to put the 500 soles together with his existing capital so that he can hire laborers and buy sacks of organic fertilizer such as bird guano.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
La señora Ventura tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijas hija, reside en una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Ventura desde hace 5 años que estableció su negocio de pulpería, vende productos de la canasta básica como azúcar, frijoles, arroz, harina, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas, condimentos, productos de aseo, refrescos y golosinas.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de Carnes, granos básicos, embutidos, refrescos, verduras  y lácteos.
Su meta es poder vender mercadería en su tienda, al ofrecer otros productos su clientela aumentara al igual que sus ingresos y lograr estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ventura, age 55, is single and has two daughters.  She lives in a community in the San Pedro Sula municipality in the Cortés department.

Five years ago Ventura decided to establish her grocery business.  She sells basic needs products like sugar, beans, rice, flour, over the counter medicine, candy, condiments, cleaning products, and soft drinks.

She has currently requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She plans to use it to buy meat, basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, vegetables, and dairy products.

Her goal is to be able to sell merchandise in her store.  Upon offering other products, her clientele will increase, as will her income.  This way she will manage to have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Wendy Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Wendy tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una hija, reside en una comunidad del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Ella desde hace 10 años que estableció su negocio de pulpería, vende productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, harina, cereales, medicamentos de uso común, golosinas, condimentos y productos de aseo.
Ha solicitado un prestamos por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de Carnes, granos básicos, embutidos, refrescos y lácteos.
Ella espera aumentar su clientela y generar mayores ingresos.
Su meta es utilizar sus ganancias en el pago de su casa.
texts.en:
Wendy, age 31, is single and has a daughter.  She lives in a community in the San Pedro Sula municipality in the Cortes department.

She established her grocery store business ten years ago.  She sells grocery products like rice, sugar, beans, flour, basic grains, over the counter medicine, candy, condiments, and cleaning products.

She has requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras.  She plans to use it to buy meat, basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, and dairy products.

She hopes to increase her clientele and to generate more income.

Her goal is for her income to go towards paying for her house.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, sausages, soft drinks, and dairy products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 34 años, lleva un matrimonio con Cayo de 33 años, producto de su feliz matrimonio tiene dos hijos, Soledad y Adriel de 14 y 11 años respectivamente, comparten sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda construida a base de bloques de adobe. Hace 3 años decidió dar un giro a su actividad económica, desde entonces se dedica a la producción integral de cacao, optó por este rubro debido a ser una actividad algo mas dinámica mas no sencilla. Es poseedora de unas parcelas adquiridas a unos tíos quienes en calidad de sobrina optaron por brindarle un precio nada despreciable.
Para el desarrollo eficiente de sus actividades cuenta con el apoyo de Cayo, adicionando a ello la contrata de jornaleros con quienes viene trabajando desde su primera temporada de cultivo. Considera su trabajo muy rentable debido a ser el cacao un producto permanente y de producción en cantidades masivas que dejan en cada producción una buena rentabilidad para el sostén familiar, no obstante el inconveniente principal que aqueja una producción final eficiente son el ataque de algunas plagas y malezas que se apoderan de los árboles de cacao e impiden un normal crecimiento de los frutos haciendo de este un gran problema que la afecta no solo a ella sino también a gran parte de los agricultores de su zona.
Requiere para la presente temporada contar con capital suficiente, que le permita invertir en la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo y la poda de los árboles cuyo pago en su caso lo debe realizar de forma adelantada, adicionando a ello sacos de abono orgánico muy necesarios para garantizar una producción final eficiente.  Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, desde su crédito inicial tuvo la gran oportunidad de hacer que su trabajo sea mas dinámico ya que el contar con capital a la mano le fue de gran ayuda. Se siente muy comprometida con el trabajo  de su banco comunal siendo ella muy puntual a las reuniones de grupo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará el pago por adelantado a los jornaleros para brindarle el mantenimiento integral preventivo a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 34, is married to Cayo, 33. They have two children, Soledad (14) and Adriel (11). They live together in a house made of bricks, where they share their life experiences. Three years ago, she decided to drastically change her line of work. Since then, she grows cocoa, an activity that is more dynamic, but not necessarily simpler. She owns several parcels of land that she bought from her uncles and aunts, who gave her a good price because she was part of the family.

Cayo helps her to be more efficient in her work, and in addition, she hires day laborers, with whom she has worked since the first sowing season. She thinks her business is very profitable because cocoa is a multi-season plant and can be produced in large quantities, which results in good profits for supporting her family. However, the main obstacles affecting an efficient production are plagues and weeds that take over the cocoa tree and hinder the fruit’s growth. These are not only her problems; they affect most farmers in the region.

She requires now enough capital for the current season, in order to pay for the labor needed for weeding and pruning the trees, which in her case, has to be done in advance. In addition, she will buy compost, which is important in order to guarantee an efficient production. This is her seventh credit with MFP. Already from the first credit, she was able to dynamize her work by having capital available, which was of great help. She is committed to working with her communal bank and she attends all the group meetings punctually.

With the 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] she will pay the day laborers in advance for the preventive, integral maintenance of her cocoa tree plantations.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in her cocoa plantations.

loans.name: La Granja Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta constituido por 3 personas residentes de la provincia de Pichincha, las cuales se dedican a la crianza de cerdos, dandoles buenos resultados y asi mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y asi la de sus hijos, el presidente de este grupo solidario es Don Lizandro que con su espiritu emprendedor y entusianta a logrado crecer con su grupo y con su familia, a base de trabajo y de humildad que caracteriza al pueblo agricultor.

El credito que solicita a Fodemi, lo va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo reproductor, para poder mejorar la raza y asi mejorar sus ingresos, ademas invertiran en la compra de alimento balanceado para mantener sanos a sus chanchitos.

Lizandro anhela construir su propio criadero de chanchos de raza, para poder convertirse en un pequeño distribuidor para los supermecados de la ciudad, y con estos ingresos poder cumplir una de sus metas que es verles a sus hijo en la universidad.
texts.en:
This united group is composed of three residents of the province of Pichincha. They make their living raising pigs, which brings good results and improves the quality of life of their families. 

The president of this group is Don Lizandro, who, with his entrepreneurial spirit and enthusiasm, has succeeded to grow with his group and with his family. They have grown through hard work and humility, which characterizes agricultural people.

With the loan from FODEMI they will invest in a breeder pig to improve the breed and thereby improve their income. They will also buy pig feed to maintain healthy piglets.

Lizandro aspires to build his own kennel for breeding pigs, and to become a small distributor to the supermarkets in the city. With this income he could fulfill one of his goals, to see his children in college.

loans.use: to buy a breeder pig to improve the breed, and to buy pig feed for their piglets

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from Masongbo village, an outskirt of Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 20,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Alie is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Masongbo village, this 59-year-old man is married and has 10 children, 3 of whom are still attending schools. Alie has served in the teaching profession for 39 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement and zinc corrugated iron for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement and zinc corrugated iron for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is 28-year-old married man with two sons. He is a young man with a great desire to get ahead. He works as a farmer but his major engagement is selling clothing like trousers, shirts, etc. He believes that this business is going well for him because he is a workaholic, sincere and above all, a trustworthy man. 

Anar is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people like him. He has applied for the loan to buy the equipment to fence in the field around his house. This way, his house will be protected and his children may play in their own space.

loans.use: To buy the equipment to fence in the field around his house.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is taking out a new loan in the amount of Ksh 30,000 to invest in her charcoal-selling business. She narrates that it has been a profitable project that has earned her good results. She has employed a person to help her even as she attends to her official duties. The loan will enable her to buy more sacks to ensure that her store is always well-stocked.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks for sale

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con una tía, a quien agradece todo el apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Gloria no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, quienes son muy humildes y se encuentran viviendo en otra ciudad lejana, en sus ratos libres le gusta visitar a sus padres y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Gloria trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Gloria se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Gloria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la tramitación y documentación para la formalización de un pequeño terreno, el cual poco a poco irá construyendo para que sea su hogar, así pues Gloria seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 19-year-old, single woman who lives with her aunt in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago. She is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic young woman with great aspirations of excelling. Unfortunately, Gloria was not able to study secretarial work, her career path of choice, because she has had to work since she was young to help support her parents. 

Gloria comes from a very modest family that lives in another city. When she has time, Gloria likes to visit her parents and cook her favorite tallarines rojos (spaghetti with tomato sauce) for her family. 

From her own initiative and with much dedication and effort, Gloria started working in the fields of a large farm in her city. She often works 10-hour days starting very early in the morning. Gloria enjoys this work and she believes that its is going well for her thanks to her hard work and the kind way she treats others. 

Gloria is very grateful for the support she receives from her aunt, as well as from Kiva lenders. With this loan, Gloria will pay the processing fees and legal documents for a small plot of land. Eventually, she will build her own house on this land. In the meantime, Gloria will continue working and following her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees and legal documents for her land.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Catalogada como una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, así es Irene de 39 años, reside actualmente en la localidad de Santa Rosa región de Ayacucho. Es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos, a puro esfuerzo logró culminar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble para el bienestar de sus hijos. Anteriormente dedicada a la crianza de animales de corral como cerditos y otros logrando acumular dinero suficiente para iniciarse en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes. Viene desempeñándose comercialmente como tal desde hace 5 años en los cuales fue ampliando su negocio de a pocos siendo hasta la actualidad un buen negocio con la capacidad de sustentar la educación de sus hijos.
Considera su actividad como una amplia facilidad e inversión considerable pues a ello se añade la gran clientela que concurre  a su negocio convirtiéndola en una persona muy querida y conocida en su barrio no obstante existen personas que se aprovechan de la buena fe y de su bondad para tardarle de manera considerable el pago de algunas cuentas por consumo de viveres.
Dentro de sus necesidades comerciales desea realizar una pequeña ampliación con la compra de gaseosas y víveres de primera necesidad al por mayor, esto con el afán de incrementar la cobertura de su negocio.
Tiene el deseo de seguir trabajando con el mismo impulso para lograr así a futuro cumplir uno de sus sueños consistente en ser la propietaria de un establecimiento dedicado a la venta de artefactos para el hogar menores o mayores. Este es su octavo crédito, es considerada por todos los integrantes de su grupo comunal como una socia muy responsable. En ocasiones aporta con nuevas ideas a la junta directiva de su grupo mostrando una participación dinámica. 
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de mercadería para su negocio consistente en paquetes de gaseosa y víveres de primera necesidad, esperando así ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
39-year-old Irene is described as a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She currently lives in the town of Santa Rosa, in Ayacucho region.  She is divorced and the mother of three children.  With a lot of effort, she managed to finish building a home from good-quality materials for the well-being of her children.  In the past, she used to work raising farmyard animals including piglets.  She managed to save enough money to start a business selling groceries.  She has been working in her grocery business for five years, during which time she has gradually expanded her business into the solid business that it currently is, enabling her to support her children's education.

Irene considers herself to have a large business and a considerable investment and she has a large number of customers.  As a result, she has become a very well-liked and well-known person in her neighborhood.  However, there are some people who take advantage of her good nature and her kindness by taking a long time to settle their accounts.  One of Irene's business needs is to make a small expansion by purchasing soda and basic household supplies wholesale.  She would like to do this in order to increase the offerings of her business.  She would like to continue working with the same drive she has thus far so that, in the future, she can fulfill one of her dreams which is to become the owner of an establishment selling large and small household goods.  

This is Irene's eighth loan.  All the other members of her community bank consider her to be a very responsible woman.  Occasionally, she brings new ideas to the board of directors of her group, thereby playing an active role within the group.  

Irene will use her 2,000 soles to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy packets of soda and basic household supplies.  In this way, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soda and basic household supplies

loans.name: Nancy Grace

texts.en:
Nancy Grace is 33 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Nancy Grace has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years. She also earns an income from food vending.

Nancy Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia Aurea es una abnegada mujer de 64 años, comparte un matrimonio con Víctor de 70 años, añadiéndose a la alegría familiar sus dos hijos Anderson de 20 años y Dina de 32 años quien es de profesora de profesión. Es propietaria de una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Lleva consigo una amplia experiencia en el trabajo de la agricultura, pues se dedica al mismo desde muy niña. A lo largo de su vida ha sido la actividad con la cual pudo sustentar económicamente la ecuación superior de sus hijos.
Desarrolla su trabajo con ayuda de su esposo Víctor, adicional a ello cuentan también con el apoyo de jornaleros de la zona para hacer su trabajo mas fluido.
Considera su trabajo como único ya que de esa manera siente la satisfacción de honrar a sus padres quienes también se dedicaron a la actividad toda su vida.
Al iniciarse una nueva temporada de mantenimiento desea realizar la renovación de sus plantaciones de cacao por hallarse desfasadas y sin la debida capacidad de seguir produciendo, es por ello que planea realizar la compra de plantas de almácigo para injertos y así desempeñar una mantenimiento técnico de sus plantas de cacao, realizando esta actividad dentro de las 14  hectáreas que posee, asimismo darle un mantenimiento integral a sus demás plantas con la contratación de jornaleros dedicados al rubro.
Todo esfuerzo y trabajo sin duda van dirigidos para poder seguir apoyando a uno de sus hijos en su firme formación como profesional, “pues no hay mejor inversión” según comenta. Tiene consigo 8 préstamos con MFP, sabe que la puntualidad es una herramienta con la cual a futuro será posible acceder a un crédito mayor. Muestra total conformidad con el trabajo que viene desempeñando su banco comunal ya que nota un ambiente de crecimiento económico colectivo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de plantas de almácigo para injerto logrando así renovar árboles de cacao, adicional a ello adelantar el pago respectivo a los jornaleros para la implantación de los mismos.
texts.en:
Lucia Aurea is a self-sacrificing 64-year-old woman.  She is married to 70-year-old Víctor and her family happiness is made complete by her two children: 20-year-old Anderson and 32-year-old Dina who is a teacher by profession.  Lucia owns her own home which is made from solid materials.  She has a lot of farming experience as she has been working in this business since she was a very young girl.  Throughout her life, this business has enabled her to financially support her children's higher education.  She carries out her work with the help of her husband, Víctor.  She also has the support of day laborers in her area who help her business run more smoothly.  Lucia loves her work as she feels satisfied that she is honoring her parents who worked in this business their whole lives.

As she is at the start of a new season, Lucia would like to re-new her cacao plantings because they are old and unable to continue producing.  She plans to buy seedlings to graft and thereby maintain her cacao plantation.  She carries out her work on the 14 hectares of land that she owns.  She would also like to provide complete care for her other plants by hiring laborers who carry out this type of work.

All of Lucia's efforts and hard work are directed towards continuing to support one of her children who is training to become a professional.  "There is no better investment", she says.  Lucia has received 8 loans from MFP.  She knows that punctuality is necessary in order to be able to take out  larger loans in the future.  She totally approves of the work that her community bank is doing as she sees an atmosphere of collective economic growth.  

Lucia will use her 3,000 soles to buy seedlings to graft.  This will enable her to re-new her cacao trees.  She will also pay laborers to plant them.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and to pay laborers

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 35 years old and lives in the Buchanan community with her husband and two children. Her children are 4 and 7 and are currently in school. 

Annie has been involved in this business for the past fifteen years. She sells imported slippers for both children and women at the community market. She learned to sell from her mother, and received the initial capital from her husband to start this business. 

One problem she faces is low sales during the rainy season. She has requested a loan to purchase more imported slippers for the business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more imported slippers for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for wheat and barley seeds and for watering the land.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 49 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Patricia has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Patricia has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and spare parts for her tricycle.

Patricia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Patricia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 28 years old and married with one kid. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like bread, soft drinks, detergents and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from E-loading.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like bread, soft drinks, detergents and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en:
Aflatun, 39, is a farmer, husband, and father of two daughters. He has been farming for over 12 years, producing milk and milk products.
